caption: Table 1: Comparison among LMQL, Guidance, and SGLang.
description: This table compares three different programming systems for large language models (LLMs): LMQL, Guidance, and SGLang.  For each system, it lists the syntax used, the language primitives provided (functions for interacting with LLMs), and the runtime backends supported (the underlying infrastructure used to execute the LLM calls). This helps illustrate the differences in ease of use, features, and performance capabilities of each system.

caption: Table 1: Comparison among LMQL, Guidance, and SGLang.
description: This table compares three different programming systems for large language models (LLMs): LMQL, Guidance, and SGLang.  For each system, it lists the syntax used, the language primitives provided (functions to interact with the LLM, such as generating text or selecting options), and the runtime backends supported (the underlying LLMs and libraries the systems can interface with). This highlights the differences in programming ease and execution efficiency among these systems.
